p: In the past 20 years, two coronavirus epidemics that originated in China caused large-scale pandemics that involved over 20 countries leading to ~8,000 cases and 800 deaths. In 2002 the Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus produced 2,500 cases with infection and caused 800 deaths. The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is highly contagious and has quickly spread globally ( 1). Using mathematical models, the attack rate of COVID-19 suggests an estimate of reproduction (R0) to be 2â€“3 indicating that 60% of the population will likely become infected ( 2). As of March 31, 2020 there have been 777,798 cases of COVID-19 reported worldwide, with 37,272 fatalities ( 3).
